alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:18AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Pennsylvania...and northeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in east central Pennsylvania...Lehigh and Northampton. In northeast Pennsylvania... Carbon and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Allentown, Easton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Forks, Northampton, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, and Wind Gap. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 66 and 67...and between mile markers 71 and 76. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 294 and 308. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
